intro: Alcea tiliacea, commonly known as the common hollyhock, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, velvety flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Alcea tiliacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
